Description: Iron model axe-head: roughly made out of thin sheet metal. It has a relatively short blade with splayed sides and an almost straight cutting edge. The butt is slightly concave and the one intact lug is large and long. The piece is thickly corroded. There is a crack on one side.
Cultures/periods: Nubia and Sudan periods and cultures
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Harsiyotef, Tomb 13 Foundation deposit SW
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Dows Dunham, 'The Royal Cemeteries of Kush. II. Nuri' (Boston, 1955), 194 and 198; E. Kühnert-Eggesbrecht, ‘Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im alten Ägypten’ (Berlin, 1969), 121, M GD/20.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (139)
